text:
In this unit, we are studying variables and the relationship between two variables. We use words, tables, graphs, and equations to represent these relationships and to solve problems. At the end of this investigation, ask yourself:

What are the advantages and disadvantages of using different representations to show the relationship between two variables?

Answers will vary. Student responses might compare representations looking for generalizations such as:

  • tables give explicit numerical values for the variables;
  • getting specific values from graphs requires reading scales and is sometimes only an estimate;
  • graphs give an overall picture of the relationship, including places where the pattern of change shifts; and
  • descriptions explain what is happening with key ideas and tell a story but sometimes can be incomplete.
